MX.evidence: There is no evidence that politicians or government officials participate in events or projects affiliated with the China Council for International Cooperation on Environment and Development (CCICED).
MX.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PA.evidence: Yes, participation by my country includes  work visits to Panama by the CCICED, with meetings at the highest level. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
PA.answerer: Answered by Alonso Illueca, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CR.evidence:
"Carlos Manuel Rodríguez, from Costa Rica, is a member of the CCICED Board. Therefore, this indicator deserves a yes response"". The Costa Rican national has served as Minister of Environment and Energy and was selected as Executive Director and Chairman of the Global Environment Facility in June 2020. Rodriguez is a pioneer in the development of Payment for Ecosystem Services and strategies for forest restoration, ocean conservation and decarbonization.

"
CR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PE.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
PE.note: The annual reports of the China Council for International Cooperation on Environment and Development show that the main countries with which it maintains relations are European.
PE.answerer: Answered by Jack Lo Lau and Jorge Jesús Chávez Ortíz, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

VE.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon
VE.note: I reviewed some websites which published information about CCICED recent activities or events. None of these show information about any Venezuelan official who have taken part in any CCICED events.
VE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CL.evidence: Chile is only slightly mentioned as a partner in sustainable mining, but it does not seem to translate in actual projects. In their 2023 overlook, Chile is mentioned as a partner for green energy innovation. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response, with some clarifications needed.
CL.note: It seems China publicizes achievements along with Chile in green development on their side, but this is not a well known institution in Chile and the country's mention in these documents might be incidental.
CL.answerer: Answered by Sascha Hannig Núñez, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

EC.evidence: In 2021 the governments of Ecuador, Germany, Ghana and Vietnam are jointly hosting a Ministerial Conference to build momentum and political will to advance a global strategy to end marine litter and plastic pollution.
EC.answerer: Answered by Paúl Mena Mena, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CO.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon
CO.note: The information found for this indicator, Colombia is only mentioned in the Special Policy Study Global Green Value Chains: China's Opportunities, Challenges and Paths in the Current Economic Context, taking two examples Colombia has signed the Cocoa, Forest & Peace Initiative, which seeks to eliminate cocoa-related deforestation and Colombia has zero-deforestation agreements with the palm oil, dairy, meat and cocoa industries, in no case is there any direct and express participation in events and projects developed by CCICED. Likewise, CCIED's official website mentions the participation of former President Ivan Duque in the Leadership Dialogue organized by the Green Climate Fund in September 2020 and CCICED's official X account mentions the meeting between Minister Huang Runqiu and Carlos Correa Minister of Environment and Sustainable Development of Colombia during the United Nations High-level Political Forum on Sustainable Development in August 2022.
CO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

GM.note: my Minister of Foreign Affairs is a constant visitor to the PRC

NG.evidence: "By the end of 2009, the investment volume in ... mainly concentrated in South Africa, Nigeria, and Zambia" according to a report by the CCICED Task Force on Investment, Trade, and Environment. Therefore this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
NG.note: According to a CCICED report, by the end of 2009, ... the investment  volume in Asia registered at USD 185.5 billion, accounting for 75.5% of the total volume and mainly concentrated in Hong Kong, Macao, Japan, South Korea, and Southeast Asian countries; the investment volume in Latin America was USD 30.6 billion, accounting for 12.5% of the total and mainly concentrated in the British Virgin Islands, the Cayman Islands, Brazil, and Peru; the investment volume in Africa was USD 9.33 billion, accounting for 3.8% of the total and mainly concentrated in South Africa, Nigeria, and Zambia.
NG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

ZA.evidence: South Africa's Director-General of the Department of Forestry, Fisheries, and the Environment, is currently a member of CCICED (1), and South Africa has been represented at both the 2018 and 2019 meetings (2, 3). Therefore this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
ZA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

TL.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

AR.evidence: Ana Franchi, the president of the National Council of Scientific and Technical Research, participated in the IV Meeting of the Science and Technology Subcommittee of the Permanent Commission between the Chinese and Argentine governments. This meeting was organized by the Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation of the Nation (MINCyT) and by the Ministry of Science and Technology of the People's Republic of China (MOST). Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
AR.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

PH.evidence: While the Philippines is mentioned as among the possible countries to implement CCICED's green projects in its policy papers, there are no reports of politicians or government officials participating in events or projects linked with the CCICED.
PH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 4 anonymous experts.

TH.evidence: There is no indicator of the said phenomenon.
TH.answerer: Answered by Pravit Rojanaphruk, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MM.evidence: The indicator is not relevant anymore. The parliament was suspened with the military coup and there is no legislature anymore since the coup in 2021. As of now, there have been no observed activities organized by the China Council for International Cooperation on Environment and Development in Myanmar.
MM.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

UG.evidence: There's evidence of Ugandan politicians and government officials participating in events by CCICED. Also, in 2021, Uganda hosted one event linked to the group.
UG.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Agather Atuhaire

MZ.evidence: Relations between China and Mozambican politicians are murky. They may exist, but not publicly. The most notable events are mainly the participation of politicians or the government in the inaugurations of buildings sponsored by the PRC.
MZ.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Sérgio Chichava

AO.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
AO.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

JP.evidence: Hideki Minamikawa, the President of Japan Environmental Sanitation Center, is a council member of the CCICED.
JP.answerer: Answered by Maiko Ichihara, and has been reviewed by Ryohei Suzuki and Yuki Moritarni

ID.evidence: We are unable to find any source which indicates it. However, we found some Indonesian think-tanks participating in its events and voicing CCICED's viewpoints.
ID.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

KR.evidence: Korea is a member of CCICED
KR.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

SA.evidence: Saudi is a member of CCICED and has participated in its meeting.
SA.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

QA.evidence: We are unable to find any source which indicates that.
QA.answerer: Answered by Muhammad Zulfikar Rakhmat, and has been reviewed by Yeta Purnama

CA.evidence:
The Canadian government has provided significant funding to CCICED through the Canadian International Development Agency (CIDA), and several CIDA staff members have served as members of CCICED. Canada's current Environment Minister, Steven Guilbeault, holds the position of Executive Vice Chairperson of the organization.

In December 2022, when Canada hosted the UN Biodiversity Conference (COP 15) in Montreal, Minister Guilbeault participated in a PRC side event titled 'China’s Role in Biodiversity Conservation and Sustainable Development.'
CA.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Terry Glavin

KH.evidence: There is no evidence of activity during the period in question.
KH.answerer: Answered by Bradley J. Murg, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

US.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
US.note: Many American CEOs and presidents of NGOs participate in CCICED events but there was no evidence of participation by government officials in 2023.
US.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

DE.evidence: The Sino-German Environmental Partnership includes cooperation with CCICED and in July 2023 a joint declaration was signed between China ad Germany pledging further cooperation with the CCICED.
DE.answerer: Answered by Angela Stanzel, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GB.evidence: In 2018, the PRC, through the CCICED, and the UK government co-organised a high-level symposium (高层研讨会) on ocean plastic waste. While it is possible that UK diplomats have participated in CCICED events in the reporting period, no recent publicly available evidence can be found. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a 'No' response.
GB.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Sam Dunning and Andrew Yeh

AU.evidence:
In 2019, Australia's Secretary for the Department of the Environment and Energy attended the 'A New Era: Towards a New World of Green Prosperity' conference organised by the CCICED in Hangzhou, China. Australia has also supported various environment and health programs in China through the CCICED.

However, there is no evidence of the partnership having been continued beyond 2019. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a 'No' rating.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.evidence: Galit Cohen, Senior Deputy Director for Planning, Policy, and Strategy at the Ministry of Environmental Protection and Director of the Program on Climate Change at the INSS, has participated for the third year in the Chinese Council for International Cooperation on Environment and Development (CCICED) Conference. Additionally, the Director General of the Ministry of Environmental Protection, Galit Cohen, serves as a special advisor to both the CCICED and the International Coalition for Green Development of the Belt and Road Initiative (BRIGC).
IL.answerer: Answered by The Institute for National Security Studies (INSS), and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
